H0.text: Physical oceanography is the study of water movement, including waves and ocean currents.

H1.text: Theoretical oceanography is the study of water movement, including waves and ocean currents.

H2.text: Experimental oceanography is the study of water movement, including waves and ocean currents.

H3.text: Thermal oceanography is the study of water movement, including waves and ocean currents.

A4.text: Physical oceanography is the study of physical conditions and physical processes within the ocean, especially the motions and physical properties of ocean waters.

A5.text: Physical oceanography may be subdivided into descriptive and dynamical physical oceanography.
